name: Lockheed Martin, the Later Years Quiz | World | 15 Questions

questions.text: 1976: What planetary landers arrive on Mars?
questions.explanation:
Viking I and II.

	The Viking landers had components developed by various heritage companies of the present Lockheed Martin: Lockheed, Martin Marietta, General Dynamics, Xerox Electro-Optical Systems.

questions.text: 1978: This heritage company was selected by the Department of Defense to develop the ground control system for the Global Positioning System.
questions.explanation:
IBM Federal Systems.

	Global Positioning System, the world standard for pinpointing locations, won a Collier Trophy in 1992.

questions.text: What missile system, developed by Martin Marietta, could hit the courtyard in the middle of the Pentagon from MM's plant in Orlando, FL?
questions.explanation:
Pershing II.

	In fact, it could hit a luncheon kiosk in the middle of the courtyard. Every time.

questions.text: What necessary component of the Space Shuttle was developed by Martin Marietta?
questions.explanation:
External fuel tank.

	Lockheed developed the heat-resistant tiles that allow the shuttle to re-enter the atmosphere.

questions.text: What heritage company developed NEXRAD doppler weather radar?
1990: The Magellan spacecraft, produced by Martin Marietta and including subsystems made by heritage company Loral, travels 788 million miles through space before entering orbit around what planet?
1990: The Lockheed-built SR-71 breaks another speed record, flying between Palmdale, CA, and Washington, DC, in:
questions.explanation:
64 minutes, 2 seconds.

	At an average flying speed of 2,144.8 mph.

questions.text: 1968: Lockheed's Deep Quest underwater research vehicles sets a depth record for submarines, diving to:
1967: Sanders, another heritage company, developed what that spawned the advent of the video game industry?
questions.correct: Circuitry for making interactive patterns on the screen of a television receiver
options: Dollar bill changers that detected counterfeits 99.995 percent of the time
questions.explanation: Circuitry for making interactive patterns on the screen of a television receiver.

questions.text: 1965: What rocket launched the first manned Gemini mission?
questions.explanation:
Titan II.

	A Titan II rocket, built by Martin Marietta, launches two astronauts into space in the first of 10 successful manned Gemini missions.

questions.text: When did Lockheed and Martin Marietta merge?
2001: Lockheed Martin employed approximately how many people?
In 1996, it was announced that this was to be the name of the next generation of US space shuttle.
questions.explanation:
VentureStar.

	In 1996, vice-president Al Gore and NASA officials announced the selection of a Lockheed Martin team to produce the X-33 single-state-to-orbit reusable launch vehicle, called VentureStar (tm).

American aeronautics or astronautics award.

	The Robert J. Collier Trophy is awarded annually 'for the greatest achievement in aeronautics or astronautics in America, with respect to improving the performance, efficiency, or safety of air or space vehicles, the value of which has been thoroughly demonstrated by actual use during the preceding year.' Lockheed Martin and its heritage companies have won many Collier Trophies.

questions.text: 1998: What new family of rockets was developed for the US Air Force by Lockheed Martin?
questions.explanation:
Atlas V.

	Lockheed Martin won a contract to build a new family of rockets for the U.S. Air Force, as part of its Evolved Expendable Launch Vehicle (EELV) program. The new EELV, dubbed Atlas V, will begin launching government and commercial payloads in late 2000.
